drinkName.name: Stag’s Leap
drinkName.about: Who said Jäger can’t be fancy? Mix it with bitters and sweet vermouth for a craft cocktail you’ll love.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a Collins glass and fill with ice. Top with seltzer.

drinkName.name: German Vacation
drinkName.about: Who couldn’t use a nice getaway? This Jäger and rum cocktail will take you to faraway lands.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with pebble ice. Mound more ice on top like a snow cone and garnish with a few heavy dashes of Peychaud's Bitters.

drinkName.name: The Rose Garden
drinkName.about: Strawberry, pineapple and rose combine in this refreshing gin cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberry and three rose petals.
Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously, and double strain into a tulip glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a rose petal.

drinkName.name: NOLET’S Mango Crush
drinkName.about: Cool down this summer with a frosty gin and mango cocktail at Blackbird Ordinary.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a blender and fill with crushed ice.
Blend thoroughly and pour into a pint glass.

drinkName.name: Voodoo Eyes
drinkName.about: This frothy chamomile and gin recipe is on the the menu at San Francisco cocktail bar Oddjob.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker.
Dry shake until the ingredients emulsify.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake again until well chilled.
Double strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with chamomile dust and burnt rosemary.

drinkName.name: Grapefruit Hemingway
drinkName.about: Gin and citrus combine to make one seriously refreshing tipple. Created by Dante Alston and can be found at Stanton Social.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the grapefruit wheel.
Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass.

drinkName.name: Pistachio Mule
drinkName.about: This classic cocktail has a seriously nutty twist.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake hard, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Dans Le Nuit
drinkName.about: In this cocktail from Sable Kitchen & Bar in Chicago, pistachios pay a nice complement to cognac.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass over crushed ice.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Cardamom
drinkName.about: Inspired by the earthy flavors of cardamom, this cocktail combines espresso, pistachio vodka and cardamom syrup.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a punch cup.
Garnish with three cardamom pods.

drinkName.name: EVOL
drinkName.about: Pistachio-infused sherry? Seattle’s Shaker + Spear knows how to make an innovative cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Irish coffee glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Cream of the Crop
drinkName.about: Mezcal and pistachios whisper sweet nothings in this cocktail from Dirty Habit in San Francisco.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a piece of candied ginger and an espelette pepper.

drinkName.name: Lychee
drinkName.about: Pistachios, coconut, lychee and rum combine to make one tasty drink that’s on the menu at BDK in San Francisco.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Belgian beer glass over cobbled ice.
Garnish with toasted coconut and lime zest.

drinkName.name: John the Baptist
drinkName.about: This Irish whiskey take on Tiki combines flavors of pistachio, apricot, matcha and more.

ingredients.ingredient: Coco Lopez mactha green tea powder mix*

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake.
Strain into a Tiki mug or Collins glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and fresh mint sprigs.

drinkName.name: Lone Oak
drinkName.about: This cocktail from New York’s Dead Rabbit combines Irish whiskey and pistachio syrup for a truly nutty concoction.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a fresh curry leaf.

drinkName.name: Grey Goose Oaks Lily
drinkName.about: This refreshing vodka drink is the official cocktail of the Kentucky Oaks races—but you can’t go wrong with it any day of the year.

mix.how: Fill glass to slightly above rim with cubed ice. Add all ingredients to the glass and stir slowly. Garnish with a fresh blackberry and a slice of lemon.

drinkName.name: Vanilla-Orangecello
drinkName.about: The creamsicle might have begun as a childhood sweet on a stick, but its base flavors can become a very adult beverage: Bright orangecello laced with vanilla beans.

mix.how: Use a vegetable peeler or zester to remove the peels from all of the oranges, avoiding peeling the bitter white pith. Place the orange peels and vanilla beans in a large jar and cover with alcohol. Allow to steep for one week somewhere dark, like a closet or cabinet.

Strain the infused vodka into a large bowl and discard the orange peels and vanilla beans. Add one cup of simple syrup to the vodka and stir. Taste for sweetness, adding more simple syrup as desired. Use a funnel to bottle the vanilla-orangecello and set aside in a dark area for one more week for the flavor to mellow. Chill thoroughly in the freezer before serving.

drinkName.name: Limoncello
drinkName.about: Limoncello is produced with equal passion in multiple areas of Italy: in Sorrento, along the Amalfi coast and on the island of Capri. It’s a staple apéritif after many a dinner in Italy, and most restaurants hawk their own brand. Craving the sweet-tart pucker of this golden liqueur? It’s sublimely easy to make at home.

mix.how: Use a vegetable peeler or zester to remove the peels from all of the lemons, avoiding peeling the bitter white pith. Place the lemon peels in a large jar and cover with alcohol. Allow the peels to steep for four weeks somewhere dark, like a closet or cabinet.

Strain the infused vodka into a large bowl and discard the lemon peels. Add one cup of simple syrup to the vodka and stir. Taste for sweetness, adding more simple syrup as desired. Use a funnel to bottle the limoncello and return to a dark area for two more weeks for the flavor to mellow. Chill thoroughly in the freezer before serving.

drinkName.name: Alma Blanca
drinkName.about: Tequila, ginger, pineapple and corn all show up to class in this spicy cocktail from Austin, Texas’s La Condesa.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the corn kernels, then add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice. Shake hard, and double strain into a hibiscus-rose salt�"rimmed coupe glass. Mist with two to three sprays of Herbsaint.

drinkName.name: Yum Kaax
drinkName.about: This corn and mezcal cocktail was named after the eponymous Mayan god of maize.

ingredients.ingredient: Mexican sweet corn juice (one ear of corn yields about 3 oz juice)*
leaves of Epazote and Hoja Santa

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake and strain into the salt-rimmed rocks or cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Cornelia
drinkName.about: This tequila and mezcal cocktail from New York bar Wallflower was inspired by chilled corn soup.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (3 parts agave nectar; 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with four dashes of basil oil.

drinkName.name: Hakushu Highball
drinkName.about: This smoky, modern cocktail is stirred exactly 13.5 times to honor Japanese tradition.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass with large ice cubes. Pour the Hakushu over the ice. Gently stir the whisky with a bar spoon 13 and a half times. Pour the club soda over the back of the bar spoon and into the highball glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.

Pulse pistachios in a food processor until finely ground. Combine the sugar and water in a pot over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves completely. Boil the syrup for three minutes, then add in the ground pistachios. Turn the heat down to low and simmer for another three minutes, then slowly increase the temperature to medium high. Just before it starts to boil, remove it from the heat and cover with a lid.

Allow the covered nut mixture to infuse for at least 3 hours or up to 8 hours. Then, strain it through two layers of cheesecloth, discarding the ground hazelnuts for another use. Stir the orange flower water and vodka into the nutty syrup. Use a small funnel to portion the orgeat into bottles or a jar. Store in refrigerator for up to two weeks.

Pulse hazelnuts in a food processor until finely ground. Combine the sugar and water in a pot over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves completely. Boil the syrup for three minutes, then add in the ground hazelnuts. Turn the heat down to low and simmer for another three minutes, then slowly increase the temperature to medium high. Just before it starts to boil, remove it from the heat and cover with a lid.

Allow the covered nut mixture to infuse for at least 3 hours or up to 8 hours. Then, strain it through two layers of cheesecloth, discarding the ground hazelnuts for another use. Stir the orange flower water and brandy into the nutty syrup. Use a small funnel to portion the orgeat into bottles or a jar. Store in refrigerator for up to two weeks.

ingredients.ingredient: Blanched almonds (If prefer to use bitter almonds, find them online or at a Mediterranean grocery store)

mix.how: Pulse almonds in a food processor until finely ground. Combine the sugar and water in a pot over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves completely. Boil the syrup for three minutes, then add in the ground almonds. Turn the heat down to low and simmer for another three minutes, then slowly increase the temperature to medium high. Just before it starts to boil, remove it from the heat and cover with a lid.

Allow the covered nut mixture to infuse for at least 3 hours or up to 8 hours. Then, strain it through two layers of cheesecloth, discarding the ground almonds for another use. Stir the orange flower water and brandy into the nutty syrup. Use a small funnel to portion the orgeat into bottles or a jar. Store in refrigerator for up to two weeks.

drinkName.name: Sakura-chan
drinkName.about: This sake-based cocktail from Warren Lindsay of Andaz Tokyo is inspired by beautiful cherry blossoms.

mix.how: Add all ingredients, except the Kirsch, to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into a sake glass over one large piece of ice. Float the Kirsch over top and garnish with a sakura flower and cherry.

drinkName.name: Kentucky Mule
drinkName.about: Who says you can’t have your copper mug and your bourbon, too? This twist on the Moscow Mule pairs American whiskey and ginger beer for a refreshing summer cocktail.

mix.how: Add the bourbon and lime juice to a Moscow Mule mug or a highball glass.
Fill the mug or glass with ice and top with ginger beer.
Add mint sprigs for garnish.

drinkName.name: Farmer’s Cocktail
drinkName.about: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and double strain into a highball glass. Garnish with three cherry tomatoes.

drinkName.name: Prospector
drinkName.about: This bourbon-and-amaro drink pairs well with holiday spices and can be served warmed up or chilled.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir for 15 seconds and strain into a coupe glass.
Express the oils of the lemon twist over the drink, and gently drop the twist into the cocktail.

drinkName.name: Tipperary
drinkName.about: Put an Irish twist on the Bijou with a little Jameson Irish Whiskey and Green Chartreuse.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Express the oils of an orange peel over the glass and discard.

drinkName.name: Isaiah Rynders
drinkName.about: This savory take on the Dark and Stormy has quite a punch—just like its namesake.

ingredients.ingredient: Connemara Cask Strength Peated Irish Whiskey

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously, and strain into a highball glass containing with one large ice cube.
Top with vanilla soda and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Irish Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: This cocktail from top bartender Jack McGarry puts an Irish twist on the “original” old fashioned cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Irish Maid
drinkName.about: Made with cucumber, elderflower and Irish whiskey, this is a sour cocktail you can’t help but get sweet on.

ingredients.ingredient:
Irish whiskey
Try it with Jameson Black Barrel Select Reserve
Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Muddle the cucumber slices in a shaker.
Add the remaining ingredients and ice to the shaker and shake vigorously.
Fine-strain into a chilled rocks glass over ice.
Garnish with a cucumber slice.

drinkName.name: Rumskey Cocktail
drinkName.about: White whiskey and rum join forces in this simple sour cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Spicy Negroni
drinkName.about: A twist on the classic, a little mezcal and ancho chile liqueur gives the Negroni a smoky and spicy finish.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned or rocks glass over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Taylored Black Russian
drinkName.about: Liz Taylor once said that this unlikely combination of ingredients was her favorite cocktail.

mix.how: Heat the chocolate syrup until warm.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir.
Fill with ice, and stir until chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. .

drinkName.name: House of Friends
drinkName.about: Cocktail consultant Brian Van Flandern created this cocktail in honor of Casamigos creators and friends George Clooney and Rande Gerber.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously, and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Champagne Passion
drinkName.about: This elegant mixture of Champagne and passion fruit was inspired by award-winning actress Ingrid Bergman.

mix.how: Add the passion fruit puree to a mixing glass.
Stir, and add in simple syrup, then ice.
Still stirring, slowly add in the Champagne.
Strain into a flute and float the Alizé on top.

drinkName.name: Vickers Valiant
drinkName.about: This vodka cocktail is both sweet and tart.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients into a shaker with ice, and shake until chilled.
Double-strain into cocktail glass.
Top with splash of grapefruit soda.
Garnish with grapefruit peel.
Add ingredients to shaker tin and fill with ice.
Shake and double strain into Old fashioned glass and fill with crushed ice.
Express orange oils over glass.
Garnish with peel.

ingredients.ingredient: Knappogue Castle Single Malt Irish Whiskey 12yr

mix.how: Add dash of bitters, raspberries, orange slice & sugar syrup to shaker tin and muddle.
Add sherry, Knappogue Castle Single Malt Irish Whiskey castle 12yr and ice and shake.
Double strain into old fashioned glass and top with crushed ice.
Express orange oils from peel and discard.
Garnish with mint sprig and raspberry.

drinkName.name: St.Valentine’s Tipple Cocktail Recipe
drinkName.about: Bet you never thought you’d see maple syrup and pineapple juice become best friends?

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Hard shake, and strain into coupe glass.
Garnish with three drops of Angostura Bitters.

drinkName.name: The American Poet Cocktail Recipe
drinkName.about: Absinthe gives this rye whiskey cocktail something to brag about.

mix.how: Rinse a Nick and Nora glass or a coupe glass with absinthe.
Add remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the Nick and Nora glass or coupe glass rinsed with absinthe.
Spray additional absinthe on top, if desired.
Garnish with a lemon twist.
Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a punch glass.
Grate a cinnamon stick over top.
Press mixture with a muddling stick.
Fill with crushed ice.
Garnish with thyme and mint sprigs and dust with grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: The Ambassador Cocktail Recipe
drinkName.about: You’ll want this complex cocktail representing your interests.

mix.how: Shaken and served in a cocktail glass.
Garnished with lemon oils and a sprig of fresh rosemary.

drinkName.name: Bloody Sherry
drinkName.about: This cocktail combines blood orange and lemon oleo saccharum with gin and a little sherry to cut the sweetness.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a rocks glass over 1 large ice cube.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: Sour, Take 2
drinkName.about: Make a homemade sour mix with oleo saccharum and lemon juice to give this drink the punch it deserves.

ingredients.ingredient: Gin, vodka, rye whiskey, or tequila

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Kumquat Smash
drinkName.about: Created by Dimitris Kiakos of the Gin Joint in Athens, Greece, the Kumquat Smash muddles the small yet flavor-rich citrus fruit into a refreshing gin base.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the kumquats.
Add remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with two kumquats.

drinkName.name: Smash of the Titans
drinkName.about: Bourbon, kumquats and oregano make unlikely, yet delicious associates in this herbaceous Smash.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the kumquats and simple syrup.
Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with 6 Kold Draft ice cubes.
Pour the mixture, unstrained, into a frozen rocks glass.
Garnish with a wreath of oregano.

drinkName.name: Ginger Smash
drinkName.about: Top bartenders Jason Kosmas and Dushan Zaric of Employees Only created this complex tequila Smash that melds the bittersweet qualities of kumquats with the inherent spiciness of ginger.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the ginger, kumquats and sugar.
Add remaining ingredients and fill the shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously, and pour, unstrained, into an Old Fashioned glass.

drinkName.name: Kumquat Syrup
drinkName.about: Kumquats are perfect partners for brown spirits. Turn the bittersweet fruit into an inspired cocktail syrup and shake it into a fresh Whiskey Sour or a warming Hot Toddy.

mix.how: Add the water and sugar to a medium sized saucepan and bring to a low boil.
Add the kumquats.
Press down using a potato masher to release more flavor from the fruit.
Bring back to a low boil and turn the heat off.
Allow the mixture to cool and strain it into a clean container.
Mix in the vodka to preserve for up to one month.

drinkName.name: Waiting Room
drinkName.about: For the cocktail lover on hiatus, the Waiting Room offers a sophisticated mocktail inspired by the soda fountain. Pineapple gomme syrup delivers a silky mouthfeel similar to that of booze, and acid phosphate provides all the acidic punch of citrus with none of the sugar.

mix.how: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the syrup, acid phosphate and bitters.
Shake well until chilled.
Add the cream and more ice and shake again for about 20 seconds.
Strain into a Collins glass and top with the seltzer. .

drinkName.name: Liquor.com’s Hemingway Daiquiri
drinkName.about: Ernest Hemingway is inspiration, not author, of the Hemingway Daiquiri. His request for a Daiquiri made with half the sugar and double the booze created an unbalanced drink: one that bartenders couldn’t help but right through the eventual addition of maraschino liqueur and grapefruit juice. To reinstate some of Hemingway’s influence, this recipe uses key lime juice and goes for a whir in the blender, as the earliest Daiquiris were served over crushed ice.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a blender and fill with ice.
Cover and pulse the blender until the drink has a slushy consistency.
Divide the contents of the blender between 8 wine glasses and garnish each with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Bitters Sweet Barrel
drinkName.about: Campari, sweet vermouth, and orange bitters play nicely with aged tequila.

drinkName.name: Dulce Y Picante
drinkName.about: Want something spicy? Sweet? This cocktail gives you both.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Rim a double Old Fashioned glass with paprika sea salt.
Muddle the cilantro in a mixing glass, then add the jalapeño slice and gently muddle again.
Add the remaining ingredients to the mixing glass and shake well.
Double-strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a pineapple leaf.

drinkName.name: Hornitos Watermelon Paloma
drinkName.about: Rim a Collins glass with a paprika sea salt mixture. Add all ingredients to a mixing glass except the seltzer and fill with ice. Shake well and add the seltzer to the mixing glass. Double strain into the rimmed Collins glass and garnish with watermelon wedge.

mix.how: Rim a Collins glass with a paprika sea salt mixture.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass except the seltzer and fill with ice.
Shake well and add the seltzer to the mixing glass.
Double strain into the rimmed Collins glass and garnish with watermelon wedge.

drinkName.name: Paloma
drinkName.about: Think the Margarita is the ultimate Mexican cocktail? Think again. The Paloma is a quick and easy classic that can be made right in the glass. Whether drinking solo or with company, this drink will fulfill all your tequila needs.

ingredients.ingredient:
Tequila
Try it with Altos Plata
Grapefruit soda, to top (Jarritos or Squirt work best)

mix.how: Add the tequila, lime juice and salt into a highball glass over ice.
Top off with the grapefruit soda and stir.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry.

drinkName.name: Brillig Rosemary-Pomegranate Soda
drinkName.about: Swap that tired vodka-cranberry combo for a refreshing glass of this fizzy pomegranate mocktail instead.

mix.how: Fill a Collins glass one-third of the way with ice.
Add the pomegranate juice and simple syrup.
Fill the glass to the rim with seltzer and stir gently.
Add more juice or syrup to taste.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig and serve.

drinkName.name: Black Magic
drinkName.about: The hangover-smashing Black Magic cocktail combines beet juice with activated charcoal—the latest detox trend that claims to help dispel unwanted toxins. Don’t be turned off by the jet-black hue, the charcoal itself is tasteless.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: In a small bowl, break apart the charcoal capsules and discard the outer layer.
Whisk together the charcoal and honey syrup until combined (it will be jet black in color).
In a shaker, combine the charcoal-honey syrup with the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Cave Creek
drinkName.about: The Cave Creek cocktail is made with New York Distilling Company’s Rock & Rye—a bottled combination of rye whiskey, sugar and citrus that was all the rage in the 19th century, when it was made with rock candy.

mix.how: Shake all ingredients over ice.
Add one ounce of chilled club soda and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist and serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: Gin-Free & Tonic
drinkName.about: Swearing off the sauce for a while? This surprising mocktail mimics the herbal quality of a Gin & Tonic minus the booze, with help from a simple syrup made with juniper berries, lemon peel and loose black tea.

mix.how: Combine the juniper syrup and lemon juice in a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with the tonic water and stir to combine. Garnish with a lemon wheel and serve.

drinkName.name: Little Engine
drinkName.about: Short shake all the ingredients with 3 ice cubes, then double strain into a double rocks glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with the apple fan and serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: Not So Innocent
drinkName.about: Chicago cocktail consultant Revae Schneider is fond of anything with rum, lemon, maple syrup and a little bit of bitters, served warm. Set this fragrant punch on the stovetop before guests arrive and let the comforting scent waft as they walk in the door. Or, transfer to an ice-filled punchbowl if the weather’s still warm.

mix.how: Add all ingredients, except the bitters, to a large saucepan over medium heat.
Stir to blend.
Once warm, transfer to a punch bowl for serving, or ladle into glasses directly from the pot.
Add two dashes of Angostura Bitters to each punch cup.
Serve warm, or transfer to an ice-filled punchbowl for warmer weather.

drinkName.name: All-Purpose Eggnog
drinkName.about: This interchangeable eggnog recipe allows you to swap in your favorite base spirit or mix of spirits to create the perfect personalized punch. It’s easily multiplied to serve any size party, which means it’s the only ‘nog you need this season.

ingredients.ingredient: Dark rum (can substitute bourbon or brandy, or a mix)

mix.how: In the bowl of a stand mixer or with a hand mixer, beat egg yolks at medium-high speed until thick and pale yellow.
Slowly add two-thirds of a cup of the powdered sugar (save one-third for later) and beat until fully dissolved.
Add the rum (or other spirits), milk, heavy cream, nutmeg and almond extract and stir to combine.In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until they maintain soft peaks.
Gradually add the remaining one-third cup of powdered sugar and beat until incorporated and stiff peaks form.
Gently whisk the egg whites into the eggnog mixture.
Chill, and serve in a punch bowl.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg sprinkled on top.

drinkName.name: Ready Fire Aim
drinkName.about: Mezcal shoots to kill in Steve Schneider’s smoky cocktail that’s bolstered by chile-tinged bitters and a homemade honey-pineapple syrup for sweet balance.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a grind of pink peppercorn.

drinkName.name: Pumpkin Toddy
drinkName.about: Lean in for a whiff of this fragrant, fall-ready toddy.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the water to a preheated mug.
Top with the boiling water and stir to combine.
Top with grated cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Spiced Pumpkin Flip
drinkName.about: This seasonal riff on the classic Flip features pumpkin flavor in two forms.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and dry shake until combined.
Add ice and shake very hard until chilled and frothy.
Strain into a rocks glass.

drinkName.name: Tomahawk Punch
drinkName.about: The ultimate bubbly fall punch, best served in a pumpkin punch bowl.

ingredients.ingredient: Large pumpkin, top sliced off and insides removed

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a large punch bowl or hollowed-out pumpkin.
Add large ice cubes and top with the sparkling cider.
Garnish by floating thinly-sliced lime and lemon wheels on top.
Grate nutmeg and cinnamon over final product and serve.

drinkName.name: The Joy Division
drinkName.about: With gin, cointreau and a touch of absinthe, this pleasure won’t remain unknown for long.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Flannel
drinkName.about: Cognac and apple cider are shaken into this ice-coldbut warmingcocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with an orange peel.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a couple glass.

Garnish with an orange peel.%Coffee bitters:%Makes 750 mlINGREDIENTS:1 cup Coarsely ground dark espresso roast1 750ml bottle Vodka1 tablespoon Coconut extract (or to taste)PREPARATION:Place the coffee grounds into a sack of cheese cloth and soak them in the vodka for about 20 to 24 hours.
Remove the coffee grounds and filter the vodka through clean cheese cloth to ensure consistency.
Add coconut extract to taste.

ingredients.ingredient: Chateau de Beaulon Pineau des Charentes
Dark amber maple syrup, grade B

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a well-chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a well-chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (1 part demerara sugar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Using an atomizer, spritz several squeezes of absinthe into a double rocks glass, thoroughly coating the interior.
Shake out the excess.
Add remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir vigorously, and strain into the double rocks glass.
Fill with cubed ice and garnish with a dried orange slice.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir vigorously, and strain into a coupe glass with a julep strainer.
Garnish with one to two speared cherries.

drinkName.name: Proven Perfect
drinkName.about: Port, Fernet Branca and cardamom-infused bitter liqueur take a bourbon cocktail to uncharted territory.

mix.how: Add all ingredients, except the lemon peel, to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail or coupe glass.
Express lemon oils over cocktail and discard the peel.

Garnish with a cherry.%Oolong teainfused ruby port:I steeped loose tea (Wuyi Oolong tea and a small amount of rooibos tea) into Graham's 6 grapes port.For every 20 ounces of port, I added 8 ounces of dry oolong tea and 1 ounce of rooibos (measured out by my jigger, I am not sure how the conversion of wet to dry ounces are).
I let this steep for about 18 minutes.
The oolong flavor is definitely prominent by the end.%Cardamom-infused Amèr Nouvelle:For this I added a crushed (green) pod to each ounce of liqueur and let it steep about 25 minutes.
I would taste as I infuse though, as cardamom pods can vary in strength.
One infusion timing test I did went only 19 minutes.
The flavor added is very light and gentle.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into chilled cocktail or coupe glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

ingredients.ingredient: Tempus Fugit Crème de Cacao A La Vanille

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir.
Strain into a coupe glass.
Serve with a plate of figs and smoked cinnamon sticks.

*Fig syrup: Add 2 qts water and 2 qts granulated sugar to a pot, stir and bring to a boil. Turn down to simmer. Cut tips off 5 lbs dried mission figs and add to pot. Add 5 dried bay leaves, 4 cinnamon sticks and 2 lemon peels from 2 lemons to pot. With a cheese cloth, build a satchet with 1/4 cup black peppercorns, 1/2 cup black peppercorns, 1/2 cup coriander seeds (toasted if desired) and 6 star anise pods, tie, and add to pot. Let simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour. You can adjust thickness of syrup by adding or reducing water. Syrup is ready when figs are plump, syrup is to desired thickness and lemon peels are translucent.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Express the oils from an orange peel over the top of the drink and garnish with a new orange peel.
Rinse a chilled coupe glass with absinthe.
Add all ingredients except absinthe to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the rinsed glass.
Garnish with orange zest and peel.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a brandied cherry. .

drinkName.name: Black & Ginger
drinkName.about: This rum-based drink takes less than five minutes to prepare.

mix.how: Add the rum to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Top with ginger ale and bitters and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Black Barrel Sazerac
drinkName.about: We’ll bet you never expected this tasty twist on the traditional New Orleans recipe.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (one part agave nectar, one part water)

mix.how: Rinse a rocks glass with absinthe and discard the extra liquid, leaving a light coating in the glass.
Add remaining ingredients to a separate mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir, and strain into the absinthe-rinsed rocks glass (no ice).
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: The Black Key
drinkName.about: Drinking this rum-based cocktail is a dark, rich experience.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and shake (without ice) for 10 to 15 seconds.
Add ice and shake again for 30 to 45 seconds.
Strain into a rocks glass over a large piece of ice and garnish with a lemon peel and a maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: The Mount Gay Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: Prefer rum to whiskey? This twist on the old timey classic will cure all your ailments.

mix.how: In a mixing glass, lightly muddle the orange peel with the rum and sugar.
Remove the peel and add bitters and ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with the orange slice and cherry.

drinkName.name: The Black Barrel Manhattan
drinkName.about: Try this Caribbean take on the classic rye whiskey drink.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled rocks glass (no ice).
Garnish with a twist of lemon.

drinkName.name: Clover Club
drinkName.about: Sweet, tart, citrusy and delicious.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker.
Dry shake until emulsified (about one minute).
Add ice and shake again, vigorously.
Double strain into a chilled Martini or coupe glass and garnish with three raspberries.

drinkName.name: House of Payne
drinkName.about: This recipe from all-star New York bartender Phil Ward appears in Death & Co, Modern Classic Cocktails, with More Than 500 Recipes.

mix.how: In a mixing glass, gently muddle the raspberries.
Add the remaining ingredients to the mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and double strain into a double rocks glass over a few fresh ice cubes.
Garnish with a raspberry.

drinkName.name: The Celfie
drinkName.about: This light and refreshing cocktail is perfect for brunch.

mix.how: Add cardamom pod and cucumber wheel to a shaker and muddle. Add remaining ingredients (except for the soda) and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with soda water, leaving room for garnish.Make a small, lengthwise cut in the half celery stalk and place on the rim of the cocktail.
Slap the remaining mint sprigs on the palm of your hand to release the aromas and use them to garnish the drink.

drinkName.name: Dizzy Blonde Negroni
drinkName.about: Pre-batch this fizzy cocktail in a soda siphon and serve at a fall party.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to an ice-cold one-quart soda siphon.
Charge the siphon with a CO2 charger, shake then pour into a rocks glass filled with cracked ice.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist, a star anise pod and a cinnamon stick.Note: Keep all ingredients cold as it helps with the fizz.

drinkName.name: Gotham
drinkName.about: Even whiskey-drinkers can enjoy vodka with this Manhattan-inspired concoction.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.
Add all the ingredients to a blender and puree until smooth, about 30 seconds.

drinkName.name: Weekend Getaway
drinkName.about: Transport yourself to tropical island with this vodka cocktail that has just a hint of tiki.

mix.how: In a shaker, briefly muddle the basil leaves.
Add remaining ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a basil leaf.

drinkName.name: Golden Handcuffs
drinkName.about: Vodka and peach liqueur combine to create a cocktail so enticing, you won’t want to let it out of your sight.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist. .

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (1 part honey, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with Champagne and garnish with a grapefruit and lemon twist. .

drinkName.name: Hubble’s Law
drinkName.about: Absolut Vodka makes an unexpected friend of Amaro Montenegro in this finely balanced libation.

ingredients.ingredient: Brown sugar syrup (1 part brown sugar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel. .

drinkName.name: Celebrity Crush
drinkName.about: This cocktail is the next best thing to a bouquet of roses.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Falken’s Maze
drinkName.about: Absolut Vodka is a sturdy base for this unique concoction of lime, vanilla and Crème Yvette.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
